A ‘proseucha' was an oratory‚ a building erected for the use oi those towns where there was no syna· gogue, outside the walls by a stream or the sea-side, ior the benelit oi ablution. It was used like the synagogae for reading the law and prayer three times a day. 298. vadimonia deinde] After frightening the poor man out of his sensas, they affect to be the injured parties, and declare they will have the law of him. The stata oi the streets at night, even during the time oi Augustus, was very disgraceful. Tacitus describes it in the time of Nero, who himself set the example oi nightbrawling, which was followed by many under the shelter of his name. The same tricks were practised by Otho and other emperors.

Augustus took , great pains to put them down, and so did Tiberius ; and itwould seem from Juvenal's words that their planos having military posta in the different places the robbers frequented was still pursued. Driveu out , from the above haunts, they took up their abode in the city, where they carried on their trade (which is the meaning oi ‘agit rem ')‚ breaking into houses and murdering the inhabitants. ‘Subitus ’ seems to mean that you start up from sleep, and find one oi these men by your bed ready to cut your throat.
